revision.comment: [[WP:AES|←]]Created page with 'Dr. Ismail Shafeeu is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician. He is the incumbent Education Minister of the Maldives.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Nov 17 |first=0 |last2=2023 19:31 |title=Dr. Muizzu’s promising cabinet |url=https://en.sun.mv/85974 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=SunOnline International |language=en}}</ref> == References == [[Category:Living people]]'
revision.text:
Dr. Ismail Shafeeu is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician. He is the incumbent Education Minister of the Maldives.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Nov 17 |first=0 |last2=2023 19:31 |title=Dr. Muizzu’s promising cabinet |url=https://en.sun.mv/85974 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=SunOnline International |language=en}}</ref>
== References == [[Category:Living people]]

Dr. Ismail Shafeeu is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician. He is the incumbent Education Minister of the Maldives.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Nov 17 |first=0 |last2=2023 19:31 |title=Dr. Muizzu’s promising cabinet |url=https://en.sun.mv/85974 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=SunOnline International |language=en}}</ref>
== References == [[Category:Living people]] <references /> [[Category:Government ministers of the Maldives]]

Dr. Ismail Shafeeu is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician. He is the incumbent minister of [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Ministry of Education]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Nov 17 |first=0 |last2=2023 19:31 |title=Dr. Muizzu’s promising cabinet |url=https://en.sun.mv/85974 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=SunOnline International |language=en}}</ref>
== References == [[Category:Living people]] <references /> [[Category:Government ministers of the Maldives]]

{{Short description|Maldivian politician}} Dr. Ismail Shafeeu is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician. He is the incumbent minister of [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Ministry of Education]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Nov 17 |first=0 |last2=2023 19:31 |title=Dr. Muizzu’s promising cabinet |url=https://en.sun.mv/85974 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=SunOnline International |language=en}}</ref>
== References == [[Category:Living people]] <references /> [[Category:Government ministers of the Maldives]]

{{Short description|Maldivian politician}} '''Ismail Shafeeu''' is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician, who is an incumbent minister of [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Ministry of Education]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Nov 17 |first=0 |last2=2023 19:31 |title=Dr. Muizzu’s promising cabinet |url=https://en.sun.mv/85974 |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=SunOnline International |language=en}}</ref>
== References == [[Category:Living people]] <references /> [[Category:Government ministers of the Maldives]]

{{Short description|Maldivian politician}}{{Infobox officeholder | name = Ismail Shafeeu | office = [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Minister of Education]] | term_start = 18 November 2023 | office1 = Minister of Tourism | termstart1 = 30 May 1990 | termend1 = 26 May 1991 | office2 = [[Ministry of Defence (Maldives)|Minister of Defence]] | termstart2 = 1 September 2004 | termend2 = 12 November 2008 | image = Dr._Ismail_Shafeeu_portrait.jpg | alma_mater = [[Macquarie University]] [[Boston University]] }}
'''Ismail Shafeeu''' (born 1956)<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |title=CoNI Members {{!}} The Most Independent National Commission Ever Created |url=https://www.conireport.org/about |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=CONI Report |language=en}}</ref> is a [[Maldivians|Maldivian]] politician, who is an incumbent minister of [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Ministry of Education]].<ref>{{Cite news |date=17 November 2023 |title=Dr. Muizzu’s promising cabinet |work=Sun |url=https://en.sun.mv/85974 |access-date=2023-11-18}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=17 November 2023 |title=The President appoints members to the Cabinet |work=Avas |url=https://avas.mv/en/137506 |url-status=dead |access-date=2023-11-18 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231117170639/https://avas.mv/en/137506 |archive-date=17 November 2023}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Zalif |first=Zunana |date=18 November 2023 |title=Pres. Muizzu appoints members to his Cabinet of Ministers |work=raajje.mv |url=https://raajje.mv/145210 |access-date=2023-11-18}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Shihab |first=Ibrahim |date=17 November 2023 |title=Muizzu Appoints His Cabinet: Moosa Zameer Is Foreign Minister |work=MENAFN |url=https://menafn.com/1107448110/Muizzu-Appoints-His-Cabinet-Moosa-Zameer-Is-Foreign-Minister |access-date=2023-11-18}}</ref> He is a former [[Ministry of Tourism (Maldives)#List of ministers|Minister of Tourism]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Former Ministers |url=https://www.tourism.gov.mv/en/page/former_ministers |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=Ministry of Tourism}}</ref> He was board member of the [[Maldives Monetary Authority]] from 1990 to 2005.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Past Board Members |url=https://www.mma.gov.mv/#/about/history/pastboarddirectors |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=Maldives Monetary Authority |language=en}}</ref>
== Education == He obtained an economics degree in [[Macquarie University]], [[Australia]]. He was a Hubert Humphrey scholar and undertook a year-long program of study in [[Boston University]]. He also took a course in regional development at the UN Centre for Regional Development in [[Japan]].<ref name=":0" />
== Family life == He is married and has 2 children.<ref name=":0" />
== References ==
{{DEFAULTSORT:Shafeeu, Ismail}} [[Category:Living people]] <references /> [[Category:Government ministers of the Maldives]]
{{Maldives-politician-stub}} [[Category:Boston University alumni]] [[Category:Macquarie University alumni]]

Muizzu appoints members to his Cabinet of Ministers |work=raajje.mv |url=https://raajje.mv/145210 |access-date=2023-11-18}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Shihab |first=Ibrahim |date=17 November 2023 |title=Muizzu Appoints His Cabinet: Moosa Zameer Is Foreign Minister |work=MENAFN |url=https://menafn.com/1107448110/Muizzu-Appoints-His-Cabinet-Moosa-Zameer-Is-Foreign-Minister |access-date=2023-11-18}}</ref> He is a former [[Ministry of Tourism (Maldives)#List of ministers|Minister of Tourism]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Former Ministers |url=https://www.tourism.gov.mv/en/page/former_ministers |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=Ministry of Tourism}}</ref> He was board member of the [[Maldives Monetary Authority]] from 1990 to 2005.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Past Board Members |url=https://www.mma.gov.mv/#/about/history/pastboarddirectors |access-date=2023-11-18 |website=Maldives Monetary Authority |language=en}}</ref>
== Education == He obtained an economics degree in [[Macquarie University]], [[Australia]]. He was a Hubert Humphrey scholar and undertook a year-long program of study in [[Boston University]]. He also took a course in regional development at the UN Centre for Regional Development in [[Japan]].<ref name=":0" />
== Family life == He is married and has 2 children.<ref name=":0" />
